## Step 5: Share your app with a pull request

You are ready to submit your console app for team review.

### üìñ Theory: Share completed work through a pull request

Pull requests are the standard way to propose and review changes in GitHub. A focused branch and clear PR summary make your work easier to evaluate.

Read more:

- [About pull requests](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests)
- [pull_request event trigger](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/reference/workflows-and-actions/events-that-trigger-workflows#pull_request)

### ‚å®Ô∏è Activity: Open a review-ready pull request

1. Create and switch to a new branch for your final changes.

1. Push your branch to GitHub.

1. Open a pull request targeting `main`.

1. In the pull request description, summarize what you built and how you verified it.

<details>
<summary>Having trouble? ü§∑</summary><br/>

- If you cannot open a PR, confirm your branch was pushed to origin.
- If there are no file changes, make sure your latest commits are on your branch.
- If checks do not run, confirm Actions is enabled in your repository.

</details>
